Profile

I am now an undergraduate student in Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT), and have been a visiting researcher since Nov. 2016 in Center for Speech and Language Technologies (CSLT), Research Institute of Information Technology in Tsinghua University.

My interest lays not only in signal processing and telecommunication theory, which are two main areas of my major, but also in deep learning and its application in speech recognition as well as activity recognition, in which I am doing some research work.

Experiences

Undergraduate Research Assistant

Nov. 2016 - Nov. 2017
Center for Speech and Language Technologies (CSLT), Tsinghua University
✦ Demo of Driving Distraction Detection

◆  Developed a SDA-based driving distraction approach with my advisor, Dr. Dong Wang, which discovers prominent features from raw spectrum of EEG data using SDA.
◆  Implemented two classifiers to detect drivers' status, i.e., to discriminate normal and distraction status.
◆  Developed a demo (Qt program) to illustrate how the detection system works.

✦ Sparse Deep Neural Networks in Speech Recognition

◆  Implemented connection sparseness and neural sparseness in deep neural networks based on Kaldi Speech Recognition toolkit.
◆  Proposed a Long-term DropConnect approach, saving the storage and improving the performance of deep neural networks.

✦ Speaker Recognition on Trivial Events

◆  Utilized the deep feature learning technique to analyze the trivial events (e.g., laugh, caugh, sniff, etc) and recognize the speakers.
◆  Collected a trivial event speech database and released it for public usage.

Projects

My main projects are listed here. You can find more projects in my GitHub.

CSDT - Sparse Deep Neural Network Toolkit

CSLT Sparse DNN Toolkit (CSDT) is an open source toolkit for implementation and exploration of sparse deep neural networks in speech recogniton. It's built on Kaldi Speech Recognition Toolkit and it's released for further research on sparse deep neural networks.

Demo for Driving Distraction Detection

In my research, I developed a SDA-based driving distraction approach that discovers prominent features from raw spectrum of EEG data using SDA. Based on the features we extracted, we could then utilize support vector machines (SVM) to detect whether a driver is focused on driving. This program is a demo of the detection system.

OpenCV-based Image-processing Application

A simplified Photoshop-like photo processing application based on OpenCV. Using the application, you can convert your original photos into creative styles with a simply click of your mouse.

Publications

Conference Papers

Human and Machine Speaker Recognition Based on Short Trivial Events

Miao Zhang, Xiaofei Kang, Yanqing Wang, Lantian Li, Zhiyuan Tang, Haisheng Dai and Dong Wang.
Submitted to ICASSP 2018.


Technical Reports

Connection Sparseness in Speech Recognition Based on Kaldi

Jun. 2017

Introduction to my work on connection sparseness in Automatic Speech Recognition, which is based on Kaldi ASR toolkit. Including the specific procedures of my experiments, the preliminary results as well as the guidance to replicate my work.

Long-term DropConnect in Speech Recognition

Aug. 2017

Introduction to my work on the new Long-term DropConnect approach, which could further save the storage and improve the performance of deep neural networks.

Neural Sparseness in Speech Recognition Based on Kaldi

Oct. 2017

Introduction to my work on neural sparseness in Automatic Speech Recognition, which is based on Kaldi ASR toolkit. Including the specific procedures of my experiments, the preliminary results as well as the guidance to replicate my work.

Reports

Review on Sparse Neural Network

May. 2017
Center for Speech and Language Technologies (CSLT), Tsinghua University

A review on related works on sparse neural network, including detailed introduction to various approches to sparsify a neural network.

Semantic Trajectory Mining

Jun. 2017
State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology (SKL-NST), Beijing Univerisity of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT)

A summary on my work on semantic trajectory mining, including some work on trajectory prediction and a travel recommender system.
